result.execSummary:
The defendant Wilton C. Calderon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $1,938.04, to be paid out of cash bond posted on the case and that amount to be paid first from cash out of the bond and thereafter, the bonded cash can be used to pay costs and surcharges that have been imposed.

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with the law. Pay costs in full at least 90 days prior to discharge.
Defendant is to not possess any firearm or body armor.

Have a mental health assessment following discharge from initial confinement and comply with treatment recommendations, including to establish treatment and engage in psychotherapy in the sort referenced recommended by the doctor.
No contact either direct or indirect with any of the victims referenced in the complaint or the read in offenses referenced in the PSI.

Not Eligible for Earned Release.
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration.
Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry for mandatory period of 15 years.
Comply with sex offender treatment recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments deemed appropriate by DOC.
Sign releases permitting DOC to obtain copies of records and medications prescribed by pharmacies.
Provide DNA if not done so.
Obtain and maintain employment or return for education full time or a combination of the two to equal full time when starting extended supervision.
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 3 and Count 6

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3 and Count 6.

Defendant Wilton C. Calderon in court with attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Constable has no corrections/deletions/corrections.

Court has also reviewed the sentencing report, dated June 19, 2017.
State has received this report and has reviewed it.

Court has also reviewed the sentencing memorandum with attachments provided by Atty Verhoff. 
State has also received this memorandum and has reviewed it as well.

Court has also reviewed the victim impact statements and restitution summary.
Atty Verhoff has received these statements as well, there is no dispute to the claim of restitution.

Court is prepared to hear recommendations at this time.

Atty Constable addresses the Court as to victims present. Victims would like to address the Court.
State has complied with victim notification statutes. 

9:07 AM S.Y. addresses the Court.

Atty Constable addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

9:23 AM L Andreas is called and sworn in.

9:44 AM Re-direct by Atty Verhoff.

Atty Verhoff has no further testimony to present.

Atty Verhoff addresses the Court prior to sentencing. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing. 

10:16 AM Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, references a report as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-463 Count 3: 
Determinate Prison Sentence for 90 months
Initial Confinement for 40 months
Extended Supervision for 50 months
Not Eligible for Earned Release
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
Conditions:
No contact either direct or indirect with any of the victims referenced in the complaint or the read in offenses referenced in the PSI
Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry for mandatory period of 15 years
Comply with sex offender treatment recommendations
Comply with any other assessments deemed appropriate by DOC
Sign releases permitting DOC to obtain copies of records and medications prescribed by pharmacies
Pay costs in full at least 90 days prior to discharge
Obtain and maintain employment or return for education full time or a combination of the two to equal full time when starting extended supervision
Provide DNA if not done so
Have a mental health assessment following discharge from initial confinement and comply with treatment recommendations, including to establish treatment and engage in psychotherapy in the sort referenced recommended by the doctor
Pay restitution of $1,938.04, to be paid out of cash bond posted on the case and that amount to be paid first from cash out of the bond and thereafter, the bonded cash can be used to pay costs and surcharges that have been imposed
If there are any amounts remain unpaid, to be paid out of prison account in the amount up to the maximum determined by law
Defendant is to not possess any firearm or body armor

15CF-463 Count 6:

Initial Confinement for 40 months
Extended Supervision for 50 months
Not Eligible for Earned Release
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
Consecutive to Count 3

Pay costs


15CF-463 Count 11:

Extended Supervision for 20 months
Not Eligible for Earned Release
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
Concurrent to Count 3 and Count 6
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3 and Count 6
Pay costs

Court provides to Defendant the written determinate prison imposed. 

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Wisconsin State Prison System.

Defendant Wilton C. Calderon in court with attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff.  Elizabeth Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:06 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.
 
State filed an Amended Information and a Statement of Uncharged Read-Ins
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Verhoff waives formal reading of the amended information.
State has complied with victim notification; multiple victim's appear in Court today.
Court makes statement regarding the Comstock Notice that had been filed and a signed copy has been provided to the defense attorney.
Court has a couple of questions with regards to the Comstock Notice and asks these on the record; Atty Constable responds.
Atty Constable makes further statements that the agreement reached is in the best interest of the victims and the public.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - Guilty
Count 7 - DRI
Count 8 - DRI
Count 9 - DRI
Count 10 - DRI
Count 11 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 3, 6 & 11 and Count's 1, 2, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9 & 10 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered
Court is requesting a scheduling conference.
Parties are to set up a time with the JA in Branch 2.
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing.
